summary: This program allow you to add to a NIF file any mesh you like from OBJ file.
descriptionHtml:
[color=lightblue][b]Name: Mesh Tool N1 - MeshInjector[/b][/color]
Data: 01/04/2013
Version: 1.00
Author: Anton


[heading][color=yellow]Description:[/color][/heading]
This program allow you to add to a NIF file any mesh you like.
You just need to export your object from favorite 3D editor to common OBJ format. This tool change only [b][u][NiTriShapeData][/u][/b] block, any other NIF blocks (shaders, lights, transperansy, animation...) remains same.
(You can use it with conjunction with my another tool: "[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/34373/]SkinInjector[/url]")

Video Tutorial for 3Dmax users from [b]Marthgun[/b] (~27:00 is actually about "MeshInjector"):
[youtube]C4aLLDwg2rc[/youtube]

[heading][color=yellow]Main features:[/color][/heading]
- mass injection: one mesh to pack of NIF files
- let use any 3D editor
- fast work

[heading][color=yellow]How to use it:[/color][/heading]
This program is supposed to be used at command prompt. (Start->Run->"cmd.exe")
If you run the tool without parameters you will see a little help about it.

[color=lightblue][b]---> Example: "MeshInjector OldHelmet.NIF NewHelmet.OBJ -q"[/b][/color]
You will get new NIF file with prefix "_new": "OldHelmet_new.NIF" with new mesh inside.

[heading][color=yellow]List of parameters:[/color][/heading]
First - name of NIF file (program will try to inject new mesh here)
Second - name of OBJ file (here must be your new model)
Third - (optional) "-q" - remove ALL questions and confirmations (and force program to use "default" options)

[heading][color=yellow]Default options is:[/color][/heading]
- use "normal" algorithm to generate UV map (try always use this option)
- flip UV map on V coordinate
- make injection even if vertex number of new model is not equal to the object already existed in NIF file

[heading][color=yellow]How program decide what [NiTriShapeData] block to use:[/color][/heading]
New object will be imported to NIF file if program could find block [NiTriShape] with name:
- equal to name of OBJ file
- or equal to name of mesh inside OBJ file
[color=magenta](NOTE: name is case sensitive!)[/color]


[heading][color=yellow]Issues:[/color][/heading]
(none found, ... yet :) )


[heading][color=yellow]License:[/color][/heading]
Use this tools as you like, just don't forget to mention me like the author ;)


[heading][color=yellow]Credits:[/color][/heading]
Niftools team for NifSkope
Microsoft for Visual Studio 2010 Express
Bethesda for the Game
author: Anton
